Culinary Profile & Uses
1. Flavour and Form

‘AromiStax’ offers the quintessential, powerful rosemary profile: a bold, piney, and camphorous flavour with sharp, peppery notes and a clean, refreshing finish. Its needles are short, stiff, and densely packed around sturdy, upright stems, forming a narrow, columnar bush that resembles a miniature, aromatic conifer.

2. The Robust Roasting Herb

This rosemary is a foundational flavour for hearty dishes that can stand up to its assertive character.

  • Roasted Meats & Vegetables: The quintessential partner for lamb, pork, and chicken, as well as robust roasted vegetables like potatoes, carrots, and squash. Its sturdy sprigs can be used as aromatic skewers.
  • Breads & Focaccia: Finely chopped needles kneaded into bread dough or sprinkled over focaccia create an unforgettable, savoury fragrance.
  • Infused Oils & Marinades: Steeped in olive oil or used in marinades to impart its powerful, woody essence. A single sprig can transform a bottle of oil or a jar of olives.
3. The Harvest and Yield

The plant is a slow-growing, woody perennial with a strongly vertical habit. Harvest by snipping the tips of the stems or removing individual branches from the bottom to maintain its shape. Supplied as a pre-vegetated plug for a head start, it provides a steady, year-round yield of 10–20g of potent needles per week from its compact form.
